alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:29AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN SOMERSET...SOUTHWESTERN WORCESTER AND NORTHERN ACCOMACK COUNTIES THROUGH 815 AM EDT... At 728 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Tylerton to near Lawsonia to 9 miles northeast of Parksley. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Tangier, Lawsonia, Deal Island, Marion Station, Tylerton, West Pocomoke, Bloxom, Saxis, Hallwood, Horntown, Mappsville, Kingston, Temperanceville, Shelltown, Sanford, Oak Hall, Guilford, Beaver Dam, and Byrdtown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
